page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: THIS IS A RURAL AREA WITH ONE SMALL VILLAGE AND A NUMBER OF SMALL FARMS SITUATED AMONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE BLACK MOUNTAINS OF BRECONSHIRE, POWYS. THE A438 BRECON TO HEREFORD ROAD CROSSES ONE CORNER AND THE A4078 FROM TALGARTH TO HAY WHICH CROSSES OVER TWO KILOMETRE SQUARES IN THE ONLY OTHER A ROAD. A GOOD METALLED BUT TWISTING ROAD JOINS THIS TO VELINDRE VILLAGE AND ON TO HAY AND CARRIES THE WEEKLY MARKET BUS. ALL OTHER ROADS IN THE AREA ARE DESIGNATED POOR. THE CONIFEROUS HAY FOREST COVERS ONE KILOMETRE BORDERING THE MOUNTAIN AND THE REST OF THE AREA IS MAINLY GRAZING FOR SHEEP, CATTLE AND HORSES. THERE IS ONE RESIDENTIAL CENTRE, AN OUTDOOR ACTIVITY CENTRE AND A COMMERCIAL TREKKING CENTRE, A POTTERY AND AN ANCIENT CHURCH.
